hello.bio: My name is Sam. I am a designer and developer living and working in Colorado. I have a background in print design and illustration and I currently work as the in-house graphic designer for Aspen Santa Fe Ballet, a contemporary ballet company I danced with for 15 years. I am an avid rock climber and in my spare time, if I'm not playing the drums, I can be found dangling from one of the local cliffs.

projectInfo.title: Simple Forum
projectInfo.description: A simple forum built with vanilla CSS and HTML along with jQuery. The initial dummy post data is sourced from a JSON file and each post can be commented on. New comments appear in the right sidebar and clicking a comment will open and scroll to the corresponding post.

projectInfo.title: Retro Calculator
projectInfo.description: Retro calculator built mainly as a CSS exercise. Long live skeuomorphism! Not really.

projectInfo.title: Conway's Game of Life
projectInfo.description: A JavaScript implementation of Conway's Game of Life. Gameboard dimensions and cell size can be specified before seeding a new game. Fun to watch.

projectInfo.title: Drag and Drop Puzzle
projectInfo.description: A puzzle built using the drag and drop API. Features 3 different difficulty levels and a pretty rocking reward for completion.

projectInfo.title: Eureka UI Framework
projectInfo.description: Built for a Bov Academy hackathon with a team of other BA students. In addition to designing the UI, I built out the carousels, alerts, collapse, pagination, and dropdown components. I also developed an unique component called "Bookmarklet" which allows the user to highlight and bookmark sections of text.

projectInfo.title: Many Styled Forms
projectInfo.description: A variety of styled forms including some basic client-side validation. Click the demo link to see more.

projectInfo.title: Link Harvester
projectInfo.description: A simple link harvester that will scrape the provided text for both URLs and email addresses.

projectInfo.title: JavaScript Free(ish) Portfolio
projectInfo.description: My previous developer portfolio site that uses only CSS and HTML for the majority of the UI with some JS sprinkled in for little additions such as the smooth-scroll, sticky sidebar, and Numbers API project. There are a variety of showcased projects as well as some nifty skills graphs.

projectInfo.title: Bov Academy Student Website
projectInfo.description: Build with a small team of fellow Bov Academy students from the ground up. The only framework used is the GreenSock Animation Platform for the grid to modal animations (and a sprinkling of jQuery). Features a grid of student images that link to a small profile modal for each student. The grid features custom GIF animations on hover as well as HTML5 video embeds.

projectInfo.title: Tic-Tac-Toe game
projectInfo.description: A simple tic-tac-toe game built with jQuery. If you lose to the computer, you will be shamed (mildly).
